channel.title: ASF JIRA

item.title: [HBASE-8165] Move to Hadoop 2.1.0-beta from 2.0.x-alpha (WAS: Update our protobuf to 2.5 from 2.4.1)
item.description: Update to new 2.5 pb. Some speedups and a new PARSER idiom that bypasses making a builder.
item.summary: Move to Hadoop 2.1.0-beta from 2.0.x-alpha (WAS: Update our protobuf to 2.5 from 2.4.1)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Here is patch. I regen'd all our pb code using the 2.5 protoc. In a few places I made use of the new PARSER idiom. Otherwise, there is little to this patch.

This message is automatically generated.
Is Hadoop using 2.5? Do we need two protocs installed to build Hadoop and HBase ? Will a 2.5 shipped with HBase collide with 2.4 library shipped with the HDFS client on the classpath?

Andrew Purtell Hadoop is not using 2.5. Doubt hadoop1 will ever get pb2.5. Ditto hadoop2. Regards protoc, yeah, if you were going to gen pb classes, you might be in awkward position where you would different protocs. You think this a killer (2.5 has some purported speedups....).
Harsh opened HADOOP-9346 for Hadoop to compile with protoc 2.5

Regards protoc, yeah, if you were going to gen pb classes, you might be in awkward position where you would different protocs. You think this a killer (2.5 has some purported speedups....).

I worry about collisions between different versions of the protobuf library jar on the classpath wrt. HBase and the HDFS client.

Needing distinct versions of protoc for building HBase and Hadoop is not a big deal (for me).
Hmm, HADOOP-9346 may indicate that if the PB 2.5 library is seen first on the classpath then code generated by 2.4 (e.g. HDFS client) will fail to link.

Andrew Purtell What we do here? Not upgrade until hadoop does? And since we support multiple hadoops? The issue over HADOOP-9348 is just the glue code that was expecting a 2.5 not finding code that was generated by a 2.5 protoc... easy enough to recognize and an issue we shouldn't have.... (Code generated by a protoc 2.5 might be useable by a glue code that was expecting 2.4 generated pbs).
Ok, since I'm worried about a possibility, let's try it and see.

Rebase.

Seems good locally but let me run it through hadoopqa.

+1 to revert – working off of a branch before this commit, I've got the trunk against hadoop2 down to 2-3 fails cases in one test class. With the patch we have 200+ unittest failures.

@Sergey:
Even if you install protobuf 2.5.0 locally, tests based on hadoop 2.0 would still fail because hadoop and HBase use incompatible protobuf versions, embedded in their RPC engine.

I'll hold off updating PB then.

Reverted. We can't update pbs while hadoop generated pb code that is in our classpath was made using older version of protoc.

Sorry fo inconvenience caused.

Snapshots use protobuf doesn't it?

I see to proto files:

ErrorHandling.proto - Used by ForeignException class which seems to be only used by snapshot classes
hbase.proto - contains SnapshotDescription

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Move our baseline hadoop2 from hadoop-2.0.x-alpha to hadoop-2.1-x-beta. The main change in hbase is changing our protobufs so all are now generated using protoc 2.5 instead of 2.4.1. Some small changes too were made to take advantage of new speedups in 2.5 protobufs (more to come).

Adds new flag hbase.testing.preserve.testdir which you can set to preserve test data (also puts the mapreduce1 data under the test dir rather than to the side in test-dir as it has been up to this -- cannot corral the yarn/mrv2 test dir --- it is always under target).
